original: Linden, Lars Vilhelm, riksdagsman, Gamleby, f. 29/11/918 i Lindärva, Ska-rab. 1., av Gustaf L. o. Mina Lindström. G. 21 m. Telma Daleen. Barn: Inger f. 21, Hjördis 25. — Folkskoll :-ex. i Växjö 20. Stud:res. på off. uppdr. t. Finl. 43 o. 45, t. Tyskl. o. Schw^eiz 47. Lär. i Främmestad 20, i Döderhuk 21, i Lofta sed. 21, e. lär. v. Gamleby folkhögsk. sed. 32. Förste omb :man i Sv:es alim. folksk :ilär :för-en. 38-43, led. av dess centr:styr. 39-44, tf. folksk :insp. olika period. 38-44, led. av landstinget sed. 26 o. av dess förvaltn :utsk. sed. 35, ordf. 39, ordf. i Tjusts soc :dem. kretsorg. 22-47, led. av styr. f. Kalmar 1. soc :dem. partidistr. sed. 22, olika konim. uppdr. sed. 22, led. av styr. f. N. Kalmar 1. folkhögsk. o. lantmannask. 32, ordf. 46, ordf. i styr. f. Gamleby mödra- o. spädbarnshem sed. 40, N. Kalmar 1. hembygdsförb. sed. 40, Skand. Bankens avd:kont. i Gamleby sed. 41 o. A-B Västerviks-Tryckeriet sed. 46, led. av styr. f. Nannylunds skolhem i Eksjö sed. 43, Birgitta sjuksköt :sk’. i Linköp. o. landstingens centr. lönend sed. 44, led. av riksd. andra kamm. 37-43 o. av riksd. första kamm. sed. 44, led. av konst :utsk., led. av allm. lönendn 41, deleg. h. 41 års lärarlö-nesakk. 41-42, led. av folksk. pens:-sakk. 42, ordf. i befolkn :utredn. soc:-pedag. deleg. 43-46, av Kgl. Maj:t utsedd länsrepr. f. komm :indeln. 46, ordf. i -styr. i Norshoilni-Västervik-Hultsfreds Järnv. A-B sed. 47, led. av styr. f. Simfrämj., huv :man i Fören. f. folkbad. Medarb. i olika tidn. o. tidskr., red. o. ansv. utg. av Väster-viks-Demokraten sed. 44. Pseud.: Magister Lars, Ville Gustavsson, LVL-n.
translated: Linden, Lars Vilhelm, Member of Parliament, Gamleby, born on 29/11/1918 in Lindärva, Skaraborg County, son of Gustaf L. and Mina Lindström. Married on 21, Telma Daleen. Children: Inger born in 1921, Hjördis born in 1925. Elementary school exam in Växjö in 1920. Study trips on official assignments to Finland in 1943 and 1945, to Germany and Switzerland in 1947. Teacher in Främmestad in 1920, in Döderhuk in 1921, in Lofta since 1921, and later a teacher at Gamleby Folk High School since 1932. First committee member in the National Association of Swedish Elementary School Teachers from 1938 to 1943, member of its central board from 1939 to 1944, acting school inspector during different periods from 1938 to 1944, member of the County Council (Landstinget) since 1926 and its administrative committee since 1935, chairman in 1939. Chairman of the Tjust Social Democratic District Organization from 1922 to 1947, member of the board for the Kalmar Social Democratic Party District since 1922 and various other committees since 1922, member of the board for N. Kalmar First Folk High School and Agricultural School in 1932, chairman in 1946, chairman of the board for Gamleby Maternity and Infant Home since 1940, N. Kalmar Home District Association since 1940, Skandia Bank's branch office in Gamleby since 1941, and A-B Västerviks-Tryckeriet since 1946. Member of the board for Nannylunds School Home in Eksjö since 1943, Birgitta Nursing School in Linköping and the County Council's Central Salary Committee since 1944, member of the Second Chamber of the Parliament from 1937 to 1943, and the First Chamber since 1944. Member of the Art Committee and the General Salary Committee since 1941, delegate in the 1941 Teacher Salary Committee, member of the Elementary School Pension Committee in 1942, chairman of the Population Committee and Social Pedagogical Delegation in 1943-1946, appointed county representative for the Communal Induction in 1946, chairman of the board for Norsholm-Västervik-Hultsfred Railway since 1947, member of the board for Simfrämjande (promotion of swimming), and chairman of the Association for Public Bathing. Contributor to various newspapers and magazines, editor and responsible publisher of Västerviks-Demokraten since 1944. Pseudonyms: Magister Lars, Ville Gustavsson, LVL-n.
